summary: #Person1# asks Ms. Dawson to give a dictation to #Person1#. #Person1# tells Ms. Dawson that all office communications are restricted to email correspondence and official memos and the use of Instant Message programs is strictly forbidden. #Person1# asks Ms. Dawson to type up and distribute the memo before 4 pm.

#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2# got stuck in traffic again and #Person2# suggests #Person1# start using public transport system to work. #Person1# feels bad about how much #Person2#'s car is adding to the pollution problem in this city. #Person2# suggests #Person1# start biking to work when it's nicer outside.
Kate tells #Person1# that Masha and Hero are getting divorced. She thinks they are well matched. She also tells #Person1# about the children.
#Person1# gives a birthday gift to Brian. #Person1# invites Brian to the party and they will have a drink together to celebrate his birthday.
#Person1# and #Person2# are in the Olympic stadium. #Person2# tells #Person1# the Olympic stadium will be finished this June.

#Person1# tells #Person2# #Person1#'s going to write up a business plan, get some investors, and start working for #Person1#. #Person1# thinks it can't be hard to write up a business plan before. #Person2# tells #Person1# to include an executive summary, introduce and describe the goods or services, and analyze the market analysis.
#Person2# feels itchy and thinks #Person2# has chicken pox. #Person1# thinks #Person2# is contagious and suggests #Person2# take an oatmeal bath.
#Person2# is checking out and asks #Person1# to check the bill. #Person1# corrects the bill and apologizes.
Steven tells #Person1# his wife found out that he had an affair with his secretary. #Person1# will try to persuade her to reconsider the divorce.
#Person1# and #Person2# talk about Abraham Lincoln and admire him for his courage and humility.
#Person2# tells #Person1# that the north of China is experiencing severe sandstorms and the number of people with respiratory tract infections tends to rise after sandstorms.
#Person1# invites Francis to #Person1#'s birthday party. Francis gives him a remote car model and his favorite brand.
Steven tells Tony that he got caught cheating and he feels awful that he didn't study and he cheated.
Tom tells #Person1# that he has to catch the nine-thirty train and the railway station is close.
#Person1# asks #Person2# for advice about adjusting #Person1#'s life. #Person2# advises #Person1# to get plenty of sleep and exercise.
#Person1# invites #Person2# to Ruojia's party. #Person2# tells #Person1# Ruojia got married and #Person1# will bring a tea set and a couple of wineglasses.
#Person1# and #Person2# are playing a game. #Person1# thinks it's cruel but #Person2# thinks it's fun.
#Person1# asks Mike about his sister's appearance.
#Person2# has a fever and #Person1# asks #Person2# to call in sick.
#Person1# helps #Person2# buy a new mobile phone.
Frank tells Judy he will work for the Post Office because the government offers excellent health insurance benefits. Judy thinks it's a great employment benefit.

#Person1# interviews #Person2# and asks about #Person2#'s special skills, the qualifications, and the job qualifications. #Person2# has passed both the Cambridge Examinations, First Certificate and the Certificate of Proficiency in English.
#Person2# orders a medium rare steak with #Person1#'s assistance.
#Person1# congratulates Tom for winning the Nobel Prize.
#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2#'s major is Automobile Designing and #Person2#'s master's degree.

#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about drinking. #Person1# usually drinks 10 drinks and #Person2# usually goes to places that have specials. #Person2# thinks #Person1# can get a lot of drinks and #Person1# likes mixed drinks. They will go out tomorrow night.
#Person1# asks May to help #Person1# prepare for the picnic. May asks #Person1# to take some food to the living room.
Muriel Douglas and his associate Susan Kim meet each other for the first time. Muriel has a nice holiday and he enjoyed skiing in Tahoe even better. His wife doesn't like skiing.
#Person1# wants to withdraw money from the ATM. #Person2# asks #Person1# to insert the card into the slot and tells #Person1# how to do it. #Person1# accepts.
#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2# is an outgoing person who likes to be with lots of friends.
Mr. Polly wants to buy a bottle of soft drink in the shop. #Person1# asks him to buy one.
Monica calls Francis to ask about the financial report. Francis agrees to meet her on Friday afternoon.
#Person1# and #Person2# are preparing for an interview. #Person2# thinks they should dress neatly and appropriately and be honest with #Person2#'s answers.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about Mike's feelings when he acting hurt and sad. #Person2# thinks Mike's reaction would be one of both anger and sadness.
#Person1# greets Mrs. Todd and tells her there's a lot to get done at weekends. Mrs. Todd thanks for the offer.
Bill is tired because he's been working till around ten every night. #Person1# asks Bill to go home at quitting time and tells Bill about his brother's situation.

Simon hates the demonstration to stop the spread of nuclear weapons. Cleo thinks it's important to stand up for what Simon believes in. Simon tells Cleo he'll go to a demonstration to study for his physics exam and he'll ask the students to go.
#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2# should never let in someone like that unless #Person2# expects him.
Mark wants to borrow Maggie's notes for history. #Person1# suggests Mark copy them in the library and asks Maggie to be study partners.

#Person2# wants to enroll in Professor Turner's Advanced Geology course. #Person1# tells #Person2# that Professor Turner is not one of those students who are out for easy grades. #Person1# will let #Person2# enroll.
#Person2# helps #Person1# to change the broken pendant to a new one.

#Person1# and #Person2# are discussing what gifts to keep and what to exchange for better ones. #Person1# blabbers on #Person2# and #Person2# thinks #Person2# insults the Sals-bury Seals. #Person2# suggests #Person1# return the clothes and not come back until the sales are over.
#Person2# wants to be a TV news director and #Person1# suggests #Person2# be interactive media.

#Person1# and #Person2# are bored. #Person1# tells #Person2# #Person1# has to listen carefully, take notes, and interview speakers. #Person2# brings #Person1# some old newspapers, some games, and some comic sections.
Sarah tells #Person1# she can buy a house far away from the city center to save money. The house is in poor condition and the neighbors take good care of it.

Mark Leach, an information officer at the Britain Business Center, introduces himself to #Person1#. Mark Leach tells #Person1# he is in charge of an information team and he acts as a one stop shop for anyone who wants to come in.
Lin Fang and Lucy are talking about their favorite subjects. Lin Fang's favorite subject is English and Nancy's favorite subject is math.
James asks Mrs. Thomas to take his dog Oscar for a walk. Mrs. Thomas is saving up to buy a bike so she can ride to her basketball practice.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about spring. #Person1# thinks spring is finally here and #Person2#'ll follow #Person1#'s cat's example.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about Mike's feelings when he acting hurt and sad. #Person2# thinks Mike's reaction would be one of both anger and sadness.
#Person2# takes a taxi to the Friendship Hotel. #Person1# asks #Person2# to speed up and pays 20 yuan.
#Person1# is broke and needs to catch another bus. #Person2# suggests #Person1# get a transfer from the bus driver.
#Person2# tells #Person1# the distance to downtown and the companies they have in their neighborhood.
#Person1# tells #Person2# Lulu broke up with Vic and wants a transfer.
Dave Thomson calls Jim but Jim isn't available. Sally suggests Dave tell Jim Jim called.
#Person2# tells #Person1# how to get to City Hall and shows #Person1# the way.
#Person2# tells #Person1# that #Person2# lost #Person2#'s passport in the department store. #Person1# asks #Person2# to fill in the lost property report and tell the embassy about the situation.
Leah calls Nathaniel because Ms. Collins will not be able to call him back until next week. Nathaniel wants to book an appointment with Ms. Fonda today.
#Person1# and #Person2# are scared when Sarah tells #Person1# she would marry a man like Dick.

#Person1# and #Person2# are at a party. #Person1# thinks #Person1# is in love with Janice and #Person2# suggests #Person1# go over and talk to her. #Person2# thinks Janice is way out of #Person1#'s league. #Person1#'ll have another cup of beers to get #Person1#'s head in the game.
#Person1# asks Jack about his favorite business communication class. Jack thinks it's not too bad.

#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about the weather in Beijing. #Person1# thinks it's fine because it rained last night. #Person2# thinks dust is no longer a big problem in Beijing. #Person1# reminds #Person2# to put on more clothes or #Person2# might catch a cold.
#Person1# invites #Person2# to watch a war movie but #Person2# refuses because #Person2# thinks romance is boring.
#Person1# asks Adam to show #Person1# around the school. Adam tells #Person1# about the building and the swimming pool in his school.
#Person1# tells #Person2# that #Person1# is pregnant and will have a baby soon.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about John dating her.
#Person2# suggests adding a painting program to #Person2#'s software to make up #Person2#'s own flyers and banners for advertising. #Person1# thinks #Person2# should add a CD-ROM drive.
#Person1# asks #Person2# about #Person2#'s flying experience and age. #Person2# is 26 and speaks some Spanish. #Person1# thinks #Person2# is young and already doing business overseas.
#Person1#'s weight has gone up again. #Person2# suggests #Person1# go on a diet and exercise more.
James wants to have dinner in the restaurant but the rooms aren't available now. #Person1# helps him to find a table by the window.
#Person2# tells #Person1# about the large area of the plant and the number of employees. #Person1# will start with the assembly line.
Rebecca tells #Person1# her first job was for a local newspaper called the York Herald. She started with them as an intern and was offered a position as a junior local news reporter.
#Person1# and #Person2# are doing a group report and #Person1# asks #Person2# to make posters. #Person1# thinks #Person1# might get lost soon and #Person2# thinks #Person1# is near-sighted.
Mary tells #Person1# how to apply for a job on the Internet and how to know which employer is hiring.
#Person2#'s making a shopping budget to save the rest. #Person1# thinks #Person2#'s budget is a good idea.
Henry tells Jane he's going to the hospital to see Susan. Jane will catch a number 13 bus to the hospital.

#Person1# is busy with #Person2#'s sales projections. #Person2# tells #Person1# how to use the spreadsheet #Person2# set up for #Person1#. #Person1#'ll come to #Person2#'s office to show #Person2# how to set up the macros.
#Person1#'s going to New York for the first time but doesn't have a tour guide. #Person2# recommends a personal tour guide service and tells #Person1# how to get it.
#Person2# tells #Person1# about the company and #Person2#'s salary. #Person2# is paid 2000 yuan per month plus some allowances and bonus. #Person2# also tells #Person1# about the fringe benefits.
#Person1# comes to sign the agreement and asks #Person2# to speed it up. #Person2# will type the agreement and have it duplicated for signatures.
#Person1# calls ABC Rent-a-car Company to report a car accident. #Person2# tells #Person1# how it happened.
#Person2# tells #Person1# how to get to the school clinic.
#Person2#'s room is too noisy. #Person1# apologizes and asks #Person2# to change the room. #Person2#'ll manage it but there's no spare room. #Person1#'ll wait until tomorrow.

#Person1# is waiting for #Person2# outside the door. #Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2#'s flight is comfortable but #Person2#'s tired. #Person2#'ll pick #Person1# up this afternoon and arrange some sightseeing for #Person1#.
#Person2# shows #Person1# the way to Liu Ichang and tells #Person1# how to get there.
#Person1#'s computer doesn't work well. #Person2# suggests #Person1# ring up the repairmen.
#Person2#'s looking for a nice gift for his mother's birthday. #Person1# recommends a gold watch with big, clear numbers and #Person2#'ll take it.

Ms. Ross comes to Mr. Fisher's to open a branch in New Zealand. Mr. Fisher tells her his son is in the second year and he enjoys it much more than being home. They decide to make a start and they will have four tables for their display. Mr. Fisher will charge for the room, coffee and snack buffet at the standard rate less 15%.

#Person2# tells #Person1# about the main differences between Russia and Canada. #Person2# thinks the people in Russia are relaxed while in Canada they are relaxed. #Person1# thinks the people in Canada are fast movers by nature. #Person2# agrees with #Person1#.
#Person2# tells #Person1# about #Person2#'s plan for vacation this year. #Person2# tells #Person1# the weather can sometimes be really bad.
#Person1# and #Person2#'s mother are going to take some fruit for the picnic.
#Person2# helps #Person1# rent an economy car.
#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2#'s fed up with those who keep a straight face in front of #Person2# and #Person1#'s fed up with those who keep smiling at #Person2#.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about the success of the company. #Person1# thinks the success is partly because of Wallace's contribution and partly because of their new marketing strategy.
#Person2# lost #Person2#'s backpack. #Person1# asks #Person2# to borrow some money. #Person2# will take a bus home and ask for some money from #Person2#'s mom.
Steven tells Lin that Americans appreciate China's rich culinary culture and they don't like tipping in China. Steven says taxi drivers and porters are not customary.
#Person1# tells Bill that #Person1# made a move today.
#Person1# asks Tom Wilson to pay his hotel bill. Tom pays by credit card.
#Person1# calls Carol to ask her if the party is tonight or tomorrow night. Carol tells #Person1# to bring a dessert if she wants.
#Person2# tells #Person1# that #Person2# works at the movie theater downtown and sells popcorn and soda to #Person1#. #Person1# thinks #Person2# looks familiar but #Person2# has met #Person1# before.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about Trump's re-election. #Person2# voted for him and #Person1# trusts that he will take good care of America.
#Person2# helps #Person1# figure out how to use the ATM.
Susan wants to give a copy of the memo about office procedures to John.
#Person1# invites Lily to a picnic. Lily agrees.

Mary and Frank talk about their hobbies. Mary likes watching movies and Frank likes art films. They usually rent movies at Movie Salon and Mary will sign up for membership.

#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2# was a member of the pressure group Greenpeace but didn't have enough time to devote to it. #Person2# thinks smaller political and pressure groups can often influence large political parties.
#Person1# apologizes to Mr. Wilson for the mistakes in goods and promises to exchange all merchandise that falls short of their sample.
#Person1# asks #Person2# to come to the station for more questioning.
#Person2# tells #Person1# that #Person2#'s dad and mom are going to dinner. #Person1#'s going to order some pizza.
Carol tells #Person1# about her New Year's resolution. She's going to cut out all the junk she eats and she's going to be a new man in one year.

Karen Huang wants to register for Comp Lit 287 but it's full. #Person1# helps her to register through the touch-tone registration system. Karen Huang is a Comp Lit major and wants to take it. #Person1# gives Karen a special code and tells her how to use it.
#Person1# asks #Person2# to share the umbrella with #Person1#. #Person2# agrees.
Jack and Daisy are riding their new car. Jack thinks Daisy's car can burn rubber and Daisy thinks Daisy made a perfect choice.
#Person1# asks #Person2# the exact time when the fire broke out.
#Person1# wants to pay 905 yuan in cash but her husband refuses because he has a credit card. #Person2# accepts and gives her the receipt.
#Person2# wants to get #Person2#'s car washed. #Person1# suggests regular car wash package and #Person2# agrees.
Harry and his wife may go abroad but #Person1#'s wife worries too much. #Person1# suggests they travel by sea but #Person1#'s wife worries too much.

#Person1# asks Johnson about how to start using the machines. Johnson tells #Person1# to warm up properly so that #Person1# can start using the machines. Johnson also tells #Person1# to get a training card to keep track of how much weight #Person1# uses on each machine. #Person1# is exhausted and wants to start on the machines but Johnson doesn't know the proper settings.

#Person1# asks #Person2# to give the puppies a bath and reminds them of the vet appointment.

#Person1# asks Ayden for a big favor because #Person1# is broke and owes $200 to #Person1#'s landlady. #Person1# asks Ayden to lend #Person1# some cash until next Monday. Ayden promises to pay #Person1# back on Monday.

#Person2# tells #Person1# #Person2#'s organization can make a decision about one week.
#Person2# recommends Moutan and Roast Beijing Duck to #Person1#.
Angela calls Dan to remind him that his friend is getting married next week and invites him to invite Megan. Dan will pick Angela up first and then go get Megan.
#Person1# and #Person2# are having desserts. #Person1# wants to try traditional Greek yogurt first and #Person2# recommends an Italian tiramisu. #Person1# finishes the tiramisu and will have a bite.

#Person1# is looking for a ticket to the science museum. #Person2# tells #Person1# how to get there and how often the trains come around.

#Person1# asks Simon about his retirement experience. Simon tells #Person1# he's on a scheme called phased retirement and he can apply for project work with the company he used to work for. #Person1# thinks Simon's company gets out of it.

Rocky tells #Person1# he wants a woman who's affectionate and fulfills his every need. #Person1# also prefers a woman who stays home, cooks, cleans, and watches the kids. #Person1# thinks #Person1#'ll never get married and #Person1#'s ideal woman is outgoing, caring, and non-judgmental.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about the heavy storm last night. #Person1# thinks the weather is terrible but #Person2# thinks they should not complain.
#Person1# wants #Person2# to watch TV but #Person2# thinks watching TV is boring. #Person1# suggests #Person2# go out and share music.
Ben is nervous about tomorrow's lessons. #Person1# comforts him and asks him to get used to school life soon. #Person1# tells him the time of the first class and the duration of each class.
Adam's knee hurts a lot. #Person1# asks Adam to practice throwing and asks him to rest that knee this afternoon. Adam will be back tomorrow for full practice.
#Person1#'s printer is broken and #Person2# helps #Person1# to print a copy.
#Person1# asks #Person2# to hold the ladder to put up the curtain.
#Person1# asks Jack to check his calendar. Jack's all booked up.

#Person2# tells #Person1# that #Person2# is pregnant because #Person2# was called to put out some major forest fires. #Person1# thinks everything is in order and tells #Person2# that the baby was conceived on February third, 2 thousand and nine.
#Person1# is worried about #Person1#'s daughter who can't decide about college. #Person2# suggests #Person1# encourage her to make her own decision.

#Person1# tells #Person2# that #Person1#'s supervisor is dishonest and #Person1#'s boss won't believe #Person1# if #Person1# tells the truth. #Person2# suggests #Person1# move in with #Person1# if #Person1# loses #Person1#'s job.

#Person1# suggests #Person2# stay at home and rest because #Person1#'s getting sick.
Mr. Faber calls York Hotel to book a double room for 3 nights.
#Person1# is looking for a cheap single room in West Derby. #Person2# tells #Person1# about the location and phone number of John Godfrey who works there. #Person1#'ll call John Godfrey on Saturday.
#Person1# blames #Person2# for not giving money to the policeman. #Person2# blames #Person1# for not taking the train and suggests #Person1# book tickets.
Darlene calls Dan to check the delayed order of 100 computers. Dan tells her the factory is short of hands at the moment. Darlene will call Steve and tell him about it.
#Person1# shows #Person2# the Washington Post, the New York Times, and the Los Angeles Times.

Marry tells Tom she's willing to work overtime to learn the business. Tom asks her to reconsider her decision and give her a chance.
#Person2# calls #Person1# for the tenth time. #Person1# will call the police and report to #Person2#.

#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about the girl living under #Person1#'s feet. #Person1# is worried about breaking up with #Person1#'s neighbor. #Person2# will call her to see if she is available tonight.

#Person1# and #Person2# talk about Mirella's dressing at work yesterday. Mirella was influenced by the way they do things on the west coast. #Person2# thinks the working atmosphere is relaxed and casual in California.
#Person2#'s going to set up #Person2#'s own law office. #Person1# wishes #Person2# every success.
Kate tells Peter she was on line all night. Peter asks Kate to rest.
#Person1# and #Person2# are talking about the importance of ships and boats in transportation. #Person1# thinks it's because people don't like to travel by boat.
Fanny and Andy are talking about Fanny's nightmare. Fanny's mother woke Fanny up and gave Fanny chocolate cookies and milk. Fanny's worried about getting into the University of Michigan.
#Person1# and Ernie are excited about starting a band. #Person1# suggests playing hip hop and #Person1# suggests playing some songs.

#Person1# buys a nice pair of clothes with #Person2#'s assistance.
#Person1# asks Mr. Blake if #Person1# can send over the training manuals.
#Person1# asks David about his vacation plan. David tells #Person1# he's going to have a nice vacation.

#Person1# asks #Person2# to take care of Pamela when #Person1#'s away. #Person2# says #Person1# is #Person1#'s true friend and #Person1# is doing what #Person1# should do. #Person1# hopes #Person2# will have a nice flight and a successful start in business.
#Person1# asks #Person2# to tell #Person1# the busiest street of the city and the bus #Person1# should take.

#Person2# tells #Person1# how to get to the central department stall.
#Person1# prefers to go to London by car and #Person2# prefers to go by express bus. #Person1# and #Person2# both prefer the car.

#Person2# orders a glass of lemonade, barbeque wings, and baby-back ribs with #Person1#'s assistance.

#Person2#'s up early. #Person1# made some muffins and #Person2# will take #Person1#'s sunny side-up eggs. #Person2#'s mom is crazy because #Person2#'s dad scrambled eggs every morning. #Person1# asks #Person2# to dip the toast into a hard boiled egg.

#Person1# wants to take a picture of #Person2# to show #Person2#'s children.
#Person2# asks #Person1# for a vacant room for tomorrow.

#Person2# tells #Person1# that Anne and #Person2# had a great time last night. #Person1#'s tired and wants to meet some friends tomorrow night.

#Person2# tells #Person1# about the fundamental concepts of an American-styled accounting.

Walter and Sterling are talking about their new professor.

#Person1# wants to open a current account. #Person2# tells #Person1# that #Person1# can draw money at a bank or at ATMs.
